CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As the annealing temperature increased from 25 to 140 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 25.4 ° , 27.8 ° , and 29.3 ° emerged , and the diffraction peaks at 21.4 ° and 23.8 ° were slightly increased. Similarly , for PzNDTDTBO , after annealing at 220 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 4.3 ° and 8.5 ° appeared , and the peak at 32.9 ° , corresponding to a π-π stacking distance of 2.7 Å , became stronger and sharper. These XRD studies clearly manifest the enhancement of molecular ordering within thin films of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO after annealing , which are in agreement with the observation that hole mobilities of devices increase with annealing. In addition , the high crystallinity of the PzNDTDTBO film can also explain the high hole mobility of the PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM blend film measured by SCLC method mentioned above. AFM images were performed on polymer thin films on OTSmodified SiO 2 / Si substrates as shown in Figure 12. The highly uniform intertwined polymer fibers are observed for both of the two polymers. With film annealing treatments , the films form larger crystal grains and better film interconnectivity , which are favorable for the charge transport and lead to an increase of the mobility . In conclusion , two new D-A copolymers with zNDT as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit , namely PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO , have been synthesized by the Pd - catalyzed Stille - coupling reaction and well characterized. Both the copolymers possess good solubility and thermal stability as well as low bandgap for efficient photon harvesting. Compared with its BT - based analogue PzNDTDTBT , the introduction of the stronger electron - accepting BO unit into PzNDTDTBO not only enhanced the intramolecular charge transfer in the conjugated polymer but also downshifted the HOMO energy level of the organic semiconductor , and as a result , BHJ solar cells incorporating blends of the PzNDTDTBO with PC71BM showed the PCE of 5.07% after device optimization such as adding additive and thermal annealing , while a PCE of 3.22% was obtained in PzNDTDTBT - based devices. OFETs devices based on PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO exhibit high carrier mobilities of 0.43 and 0.34 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively. Both the hole mobilities and PCEs are among the highest values in the current reported devices fabricated from naphthodithiophenebased copolymers. These results demonstrate that the 4,9bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)naphtho [1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene is a promising versatile core unit for developing high - performance OFETs and polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph. I will present the valid entities in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Here are the entities in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PzNDTDTBT |
| PzNDTDTBO |
| PC71BM |
| SiO2 |
| Si |
| BT |
| BO |
| HOMO |
| LUMO |
| PCE |
| OFET |

Note that some of these entities are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but I have only listed them once in the table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PzNDTDTBT |
| PzNDTDTBO |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* "SiO2" (SiO2 is a chemical compound, not a material name)
* "Si" (Si is a chemical element, not a material name)
* "BT" (BT is an abbreviation for "butyl," not a material name)
* "BO" (BO is an abbreviation for "butylene oxide," not a material name)
* "HOMO" and "LUMO" (these are chemical terms that do not refer to material names)
* "PCE" (PCE is an abbreviation for "power conversion efficiency," not a material name)
* "OFET" (OFET is an abbreviation for "organic field-effect transistor," not a material name)

Similarly , for PzNDTDTBO , after annealing at 220 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 4.3 ° and 8.5 ° appeared , and the peak at 32.9 ° , corresponding to a π-π stacking distance of 2.7 Å , became stronger and sharper. These XRD studies clearly manifest the enhancement of molecular ordering within thin films of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO after annealing , which are in agreement with the observation that hole mobilities of devices increase with annealing. Similarly , for PzNDTDTBO , after annealing at 220 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 4.3 ° and 8.5 ° appeared , and the peak at 32.9 ° , corresponding to a π-π stacking distance of 2.7 Å , became stronger and sharper. Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's go through the paragraph and identify the values of material properties for the polymers mentioned. I will present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 25 °C |
| 140 °C |
| 25.4 ° |
| 27.8 ° |
| 29.3 ° |
| 21.4 ° |
| 23.8 ° |
| 4.3 ° |
| 8.5 ° |
| 32.9 ° |
| 2.7 Å |
| 0.43 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 |
| 0.34 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 |

Explanation:

* "25 °C" and "140 °C" are the annealing temperatures mentioned in the paragraph.
* "25.4 °", "27.8 °", and "29.3 °" are the weak diffraction peaks that emerged after annealing at 25 °C and 140 °C.
* "32.9 °" is the peak at which the diffraction intensity increased after annealing at 220 °C.
* "2.7 Å" is the π-π stacking distance mentioned in the context of the high crystallinity of the PzNDTDTBO film.
* "0.43 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1" and "0.34 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1" are the hole mobilities of OFETs devices based on PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO, respectively.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
